key_points: Tiger Woods survived a serious car accident in California, undergoing surgery for multiple fractures of his right leg.
According to LA county deputy Carlos Gonzalez, Woods was "calm and lucid" and lucky to survive the crash that involved major damage to his vehicle.
Woods had been driving a 2021 Genesis GV80 and suffered the accident after crossing a median and hitting a tree.
The crash site is known for speeding incidents, with drivers often caught going up to 80mph.
Los Angeles County Sheriff Alex Villanueva mentioned that Woods' vehicle was going at a greater speed than normal but found no evidence of impairment.
Woods was conscious and coherent when discovered, able to communicate his name to first responders.
Rescue efforts did not require the jaws of life; instead, Woods was extracted with an axe and a Halligan tool.
Public figures like Barack Obama, Serena Williams, and Jack Nicklaus expressed their concerns and well-wishes for Woods.
Woods was in California for a TV program and had attended the PGA Tour's Genesis Invitational prior to the crash.
The accident drew significant public attention, leading to a second, non-injurious crash nearby.
spokespersons: Daryl Osby (Los Angeles County Fire Chief)
